message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SD. 

The paper focuses on the development of a new approach for multimodal intention recognition in human-robot interaction, which is a core topic in the field of robotics (cs.RO). The paper also emphasizes the importance of improving the quality of life and personal independence of elderly people, which is a common goal in the field of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The approach proposed in the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques, such as classifier fusion and Bayesian methods, which are commonly used in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of scene objects, which suggests the involvement of computer vision techniques (cs.CV). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach in a collaborative human-robot interaction task, which suggests the involvement of software engineering and development (cs.SD).
